edge: Refn chose Johnny Jewel of Desire and Chromatics to score the film.
At the last minute, the studio hired experienced score composer Cliff Martinez.
Refn gave him a sampling of songs he liked and asked Martinez to emulate the sound.
The album was released on CD on September 19, 2011, by Lakeshore Records.
Owing to viral reviews such as those found on Twitter, the soundtrack sold well on iTunes.
The album was released on vinyl in June 2012, by Mondo. It received positive responses and peaked the soundtrack list from Billboard.
It also peaked at 30th position on the US Billboard 200.

In September 2016, a re-scored soundtrack for the film was produced for its television broadcast in October 2014 by Zane Lowe for BBC, which included original music from Chvrches, Banks, Bastille, Eric Prydz, SBTRKT, Bring Me the Horizon, The 1975 and Laura Mvula.

node_2: blend of sonic and visual nostalgia with a contemporary spin
edge: the impact of the film and soundtrack on contemporary music culture, as discussed by Johnny Jewel in an interview with Aaron Vehling
